alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 31 at 1:47PM MST until July 31 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 245 PM MST. * At 146 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Kaka to 13 miles south of Chui-Chu to 7 miles north of Avra Valley, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 231. Route 87 between mile markers 116 and 123. Locations impacted include... Eloy, Picacho, Chui-Chu, Picacho Peak State Park, Red Rock, Cockleburr, North Komelik, Kohatk, Jack Rabbit, Shopishk and East Chui-Chu. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
